facts.fact_text: US crude inventories fell by about 3.5 million barrels in the week to January 30th.

evidences.evidence_text: EIA data showed US crude inventories fell by about 3.5 million barrels in the week to January 30th

facts.fact_text: Distillate stocks posted a sharp draw of roughly 5.55 million barrels the prior week.

evidences.evidence_text: distillate stocks posted a sharp draw of roughly 5.55 million barrels the prior week

facts.fact_text: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said discussions will take place in Oman on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said discussions will take place in Oman on Friday

evidence.evidence_text: Prices tracked oil benchmarks lower after Tehran confirmed it would hold talks with Washington this week, easing fears that an escalation in the Middle East could disrupt energy flows.

At the same time, EIA data showed US crude inventories fell by about 3.5 million barrels in the week to January 30th, while distillate stocks posted a sharp draw of roughly 5.55 million barrels the prior week, confirming strong consumption that already materialised during the recent Arctic cold spell.
